rev.comment: /* Easter eggs and April Fool's Day jokes */
rev.diff:
Line 119: Line 119:
Google has a tradition of creating [[April Fool's Day]] jokes — such as [[Google's hoaxes#2000: Google MentalPlex|Google MentalPlex]], which allegedly featured the use of mental power to search the web.<ref name="mentalplex">"[http://www.google.com/mentalplex/ Google MentalPlex]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2000]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2002]], they claimed that [[pigeons]] were the [[Google's hoaxes#2002: Pigeon Rank|secret]] behind their growing [[search engine]].<ref name="pigeonrank">"[http://www.google.com/technology/pigeonrank.html The technology behind Google's great results]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2002]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2004]], they featured [[Google's hoaxes#2004: Google Lunar/Copernicus Center|Google Lunar]] (which claimed to feature jobs on the [[moon]]),<ref name="copernicus">"[http://www.google.com/jobs/lunar_job.html Google Copernicus Center is hiring]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2004]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> and in [[2005]], a [[fiction|fictitious]] brain-boosting drink, termed [[Google's hoaxes#2005: Google Gulp|Google Gulp]] was announced.<ref name="gulp">"[http://www.google.com/googlegulp/ Quench your thirst for knowledge]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2005]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2006]], they came up with [[Google's hoaxes#2006: Google Romance|Google Romance]], a hypothetical [[online dating]] service.<ref name="romance">Fox, Lynn. "[http://www.google.com/romance/press.html Google to Organize World's Courtship Information with Google Romance]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref>
Google has a tradition of creating [[April Fool's Day]] jokes — such as [[Google's hoaxes#2000: Google MentalPlex|Google MentalPlex]], which allegedly featured the use of mental power to search the web.<ref name="mentalplex">"[http://www.google.com/mentalplex/ Google MentalPlex]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2000]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2002]], they claimed that [[pigeons]] were the [[Google's hoaxes#2002: Pigeon Rank|secret]] behind their growing [[search engine]].<ref name="pigeonrank">"[http://www.google.com/technology/pigeonrank.html The technology behind Google's great results]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2002]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2004]], they featured [[Google's hoaxes#2004: Google Lunar/Copernicus Center|Google Lunar]] (which claimed to feature jobs on the [[moon]]),<ref name="copernicus">"[http://www.google.com/jobs/lunar_job.html Google Copernicus Center is hiring]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2004]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> and in [[2005]], a [[fiction|fictitious]] brain-boosting drink, termed [[Google's hoaxes#2005: Google Gulp|Google Gulp]] was announced.<ref name="gulp">"[http://www.google.com/googlegulp/ Quench your thirst for knowledge]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2005]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref> In [[2006]], they came up with [[Google's hoaxes#2006: Google Romance|Google Romance]], a hypothetical [[online dating]] service.<ref name="romance">Fox, Lynn. "[http://www.google.com/romance/press.html Google to Organize World's Courtship Information with Google Romance]." ''[[Google]].'' [[April 1]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[February 22]], [[2007]].</ref>
â
Some thought the announcement of [[Gmail]] in [[2004]] around April Fool's Day (as well as the doubling of Gmail's storage space to two gigabytes in [[2005]]) was a joke, although both of these turned out to be genuine announcements. In [[2005]], a comedic graph depicting Google's goal of "infinity plus one" GB of storage was featured on the [[Gmail]] homepage. In 2007, Google introduced a free wireless internet service called TiSP stanging for Toiled Internet Service Provider. One obtained a connection by dropping a cord down their toilet, hooking it up to their computer, ans waiting only several days for a Google tecnition to hook it up to a server.
+
Some thought the announcement of [[Gmail]] in [[2004]] around April Fool's Day (as well as the doubling of Gmail's storage space to two gigabytes in [[2005]]) was a joke, although both of these turned out to be genuine announcements. In [[2005]], a comedic graph depicting Google's goal of "infinity plus one" GB of storage was featured on the [[Gmail]] homepage. In 2007, Google introduced a free wireless internet service called TiSP standing for Toilet Internet Service Provider. One obtained a connection by flushing a cable down their toilet, hooking it up to their computer, ans waiting only several days for a Google rep to hook it up to a server.
Google's services contain a number of [[easter egg (virtual)|easter eggs]]; for instance, the Language Tools page offers the search interface in the [[Swedish Chef]]'s "Bork bork bork," [[Pig Latin]], âHackerâ (Actually [[leetspeak]]), [[Elmer Fudd]], and [[Klingon language|Klingon]].<ref>"[http://www.google.com/language_tools?hl=en Language Tools]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]], [[2007]].</ref> In addition, the search engine calculator provides [[The Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything]] from [[Douglas Adams]]' ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]''.<ref>"[http://www.google.com/search?q=answer+to+life+the+universe+and+everything Google Search Results for 'answer to life the universe and everything']." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]], [[2007]].</ref>
Google's services contain a number of [[easter egg (virtual)|easter eggs]]; for instance, the Language Tools page offers the search interface in the [[Swedish Chef]]'s "Bork bork bork," [[Pig Latin]], âHackerâ (Actually [[leetspeak]]), [[Elmer Fudd]], and [[Klingon language|Klingon]].<ref>"[http://www.google.com/language_tools?hl=en Language Tools]." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]], [[2007]].</ref> In addition, the search engine calculator provides [[The Answer to Life, the Universe, and Everything]] from [[Douglas Adams]]' ''[[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy]]''.<ref>"[http://www.google.com/search?q=answer+to+life+the+universe+and+everything Google Search Results for 'answer to life the universe and everything']." ''[[Google]].'' Retrieved on [[January 24]], [[2007]].</ref>
